title: Workshop for Strengthening Evidence-Based Medicine (EBM) Critical Appraisal Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Requires knowledge of basic medical terminology and research methodologies
context.additional_context: Parallel practical sessions using digital devices (tablets/laptops), operating modular workshops by four themes: treatment/harm/diagnosis/systematic literature review.

learning_goals: Learners can identify at least three major biases in medical research papers (clinical trials, cohort studies, etc.)
Learners can utilize checklists to evaluate research design appropriateness and clinical applicability of results
Learners can perform evidence-based decision-making in patient care scenarios with 80% accuracy using the EBM framework
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
